p: In case 3, ocean model heat transport convergence biases drive local SST biases through balancing surface heat flux response, i.e. small ∆ F A and ∆ C R so ∆ F R ≈ λ F∆ T ≈ −∆ C O. The ocean model produces surplus ocean heat transport convergence causing the local SST to warm resulting in a compensating positive surface heat loss response (or vice-versa). We expect for R1 strong negative correlation of ∆ F R on SST biases; for R2 no correlation of SST biases on ∆ F A; for R3 no correlation of ∆ F R on ∆ F A; and for R4 strong negative correlation of SST biases on coupled net flux biases, ∆Δ F. Our results contrast with expectations for R2, R3 and R4, ruling out this case.
